Sections.Text: September 17, 1943. The Tyree Trust uses wartime research funding to try and develop an American countermeasure to combat German Thulekraft occult operatives.
Professor Keith Evans, from Miskatonic University is the Trust's liason with the War Department and the project's leader, charged with turning the horrors of the manse into weapons of war.
Unfortunately, Britain sent over the annoying Sir Wilhelm Bohn to offer his own, feeble expertise on how to deal with the house's supernaturals.
Both agree on only one thing - their best hope for success lies in reactivating the recently-excavated Golem, created by Cornelius Bosch.
With no more time to waste, Prof. Evans has decided to make a deal with the least dangerous denizens that have lain sealed away beneath the museum for study.
Sir Bohn has thus far led the outreach to these four entities, but he's been sloppy and incautious in his negotiations with these powerful and dangerous supernaturals.
Now Evans is stepping in to take over negotiations. Sir Bohn claims to know how to handle such beings, but thus far he's proven incompetant.
Each supernatural entity can summon up lesser beings and use their occult essences to power the Golem.
Bohn will know doubt be pestering the entities as well, but Evans has figured out that he only needs two supernaturals to agree to his terms.
Of course knowing Bohn, he will probably try to recruit two of his own allies so that he can steal all the credit for the Trust's research.
